goal.en: Teach students metal fatigue damage phenomena and analysis methods, including high cycle fatigue, low cycle fatigue, and fatigue crack growth. In addition to listening to the course, students also practice the application of various analytical methods through the specified assignments. They will be familiar with the fatigue analysis methods under different material properties, geometries and load conditions. After taking this course, students should have the ability of fatigue analysis and design of metals.
goal.ch: 教導學生認識各種金屬疲勞破壞現象與分析方法，包括高週疲勞、低週疲勞及疲勞裂縫成長等領域。學生除了在課堂上聽講之外，還經由指定的作業來練習各種分析方法之應用，熟悉在不同材料性質、幾何形狀及負荷條件下之疲勞分析方法。學生修習本課程之後，應具備金屬材料之疲勞分析及設計能力。

content.en:
1. History of fatigue analysis and design
2. The nature of fatigue
3. High cycle fatigue
4. Low cycle fatigue
5. Fracture Mechanics (LEFM) in Fatigue Design
6. Notch effect
7. Variable amplitude loading
8. Comparison of methods
content.ch:
1. History of fatigue analysis and design
2. The nature of fatigue
3. High cycle fatigue
4. Low cycle fatigue
5. Fracture Mechanics (LEFM) in Fatigue Design
6. Notch effect
7. Variable amplitude loading
8. Comparison of methods

textbook.en: Textbook: J. A. Bannantine, J. J. Comer and J. L. Hardrock, “Fundamentals of Metal Fatigue Analysis,“ Prentice-Hall Inc., 1990. Reference books: 1. Y.-L. Lee, J. Pan, R. Hathaway, and M. Barkey, “Fatigue Testing and Analysis,“ Elsevier Butterworth-Heinemann, 2005. 2. R. I. Stephens, A. Fatermi, R. R. Stephens, H. O. Fuchs, “Metal Fatigue in Engineering,“ 2nd Ed, John Wiley ＆ Sons Inc., 2000. 3. J. A. Collins, “Failure of Metals in Mechanical Design: Analysis, Prediction, Prevention,“ 2nd Ed, John Wiley ＆ Sons Inc., 1993.
textbook.ch: Textbook: J. A. Bannantine, J. J. Comer and J. L. Hardrock, “Fundamentals of Metal Fatigue Analysis,“ Prentice-Hall Inc., 1990. Reference books: 1. Y.-L. Lee, J. Pan, R. Hathaway, and M. Barkey, “Fatigue Testing and Analysis,“ Elsevier Butterworth-Heinemann, 2005. 2. R. I. Stephens, A. Fatermi, R. R. Stephens, H. O. Fuchs, “Metal Fatigue in Engineering,“ 2nd Ed, John Wiley ＆ Sons Inc., 2000. 3. J. A. Collins, “Failure of Metals in Mechanical Design: Analysis, Prediction, Prevention,“ 2nd Ed, John Wiley ＆ Sons Inc., 1993.

grading.en: Mid-term Exam 30％ Final Exam 30％ Homework 20％ Final Report 20％
grading.ch: 期中考 30％ 期末考 30％ 作業 20％ 期末報告 20％

en.competency: Design / Development of Solution and Investigation
